{
  "schemaVersion": "0.3",
  "description": "The AWSSupport-TroubleshootECSTaskFailedToStart runbook helps you troubleshoot why an Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) task in an Amazon ECS cluster failed to start. The runbook analyzes the following common issues that can prevent a task from starting:

- Network connectivity to the configured container registry
- Missing IAM permissions required by the task execution role
- VPC endpoint connectivity
- Security group rule configuration
- AWS Secrets Manager secrets references
- Logging configuration

## Note:

If the analysis determines that network connectivity needs to be tested, a Lambda function and requisite IAM role are created in your account. These resources are used to simulate the network connectivity of your failed task. The automation deletes these resources when they're no longer required. However, if the automation fails to delete the resources, you must do so manually.",
  "assumeRole": "{{ AutomationAssumeRole }}",
  "parameters": {
    "AutomationAssumeRole": {
      "type": "AWS::IAM::Role::Arn",
      "description": "(Optional) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows Systems Manager Automation to perform the actions on your behalf. If no role is specified, Systems Manager Automation uses the permissions of the user that starts this runbook.",
      "default": ""
    },
    "ClusterName": {
      "type": "String",
      "description": "(Required) The name of the Amazon ECS cluster where the task failed to start.",
      "allowedPattern": "^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,255}$"
    },
    "TaskId": {
      "type": "String",
      "description": "(Required) The ID of the failed task.",
      "allowedPattern": "^[a-z0-9]{1,255}$"
    },
    "CloudwatchRetentionPeriod": {
      "type": "Integer",
      "description": "(Optional) The retention period, in days, for the Lambda function logs to be stored in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This is only necessry if the analysis determines network connectivity needs to be tested.",
      "default": 30,
      "allowedValues": [
        1,
        3,
        5,
        7,
        14,
        30,
        60,
        90
      ]
    }
  },
  "mainSteps": [
    {
      "name": "00_PreflightPermissionChecks",
      "onFailure": "step:04_Execution_Results",
      "onCancel": "step:04_Execution_Results",
      "action": "aws:executeScript",
      "description": "Verifies that the user or role who started the automation has the required IAM permissions. If you don't have sufficient permissions to use this runbook, the missing required permissions are included in the output of the automation.",
      "timeoutSeconds": 60,
      "inputs": {
        "Runtime": "python3.8",
        "Handler": "iam_permission_handler",
        "Script": "# Copyright 2022 Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved.
# SPDX-License-Identifier: LicenseRef-.amazon.com.-AmznSL-1.0
# Licensed under the Amazon Software License  http://aws.amazon.com/asl/

############################################################################
# USAGE: iam_permission_handler will evaluate REQUIRED_PERMISSIONS
# against the actor executing the Runbook and provides missing perms
# if there is any.
############################################################################


############################################################################
# AWS API USAGE IN FILE:
# sts:GetCallerIdentity
############################################################################


import boto3
import lib.iam.simulation as permission_evaluation
from lib.iam.iam_const import REQUIRED_PERMISSIONS

sts_client = boto3.client("sts")


# Design Consideration: iam_permission_handler is the very first step executed
# as part of this RunBook. The iam_permission_handler should verify if the
# user who initiated this RunBook or optionally passed SSM role has enough permission
# to perform all required intended actions or not, specifically mutating api calls.
# Such as CreateRole, DeleteRole, CreateFunction, DeleteFunction. There are known two
# approaches to tackle this logic. 1) via DryRun 2) via IAM Simulation. DryRun is
# not possible in this Runbook as not all AWS services supports DryRun especially
# IAM actions and Lambda deletion actions. IAM Simulation provides more optimistic
# results however with some caveats. One of the important concern when using IAM
# Simulation is, SimulatePrincipalPolicy action requires you as an end user to pass
# both valid user arn / role arn along with required action to simulate. Here the
# problem is passing valid user/role arn. Identifying valid user/arn who is executing
# SAW SSM Runbook is tricky. The problem comes with STS GetCallerIdentity where it
# will not have direct role/user in "Arn" field incase of AssumeRole users/roles,
# Federated Users/Roles, Multi Path roles etc... In all this cases we need to efficiently
# parse STS GetCallerIdentity "UserId" field to understand what kind of identity
# that has been used when this RunBook is initiated. More on IAM Pattern Identifier is
# is documented here
# https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_identifiers.html#identifiers-prefixes
# Once UserId is extracted, we could fire GetRole, GetUser to understand if the full ARN
# of the user/role and pass it to SimulatePrincipalPolicy for verification. In worst case
# we may fail in UserId stage where it cannot be mapped Or trouble in mapping to any of
# currently available User/Role in which case we have to abort the execution


def iam_permission_handler(events, context):
    """
    The iam_permission_handler() verifies if the
    user who initiated this RunBook or optionally passed SSM role has enough permission
    to perform all required intended actions or not
    """
    results = "FAILED"
    info_codes = []
    info_message = []
    execution_id = context["automation:EXECUTION_ID"].split("-")[-1]

    get_caller_identity_response = sts_client.get_caller_identity()
    user_id = get_caller_identity_response.get("UserId").split(":")[0]

    info_codes, info_message, results = permission_evaluation.simulate_caller_policy(user_id, execution_id, REQUIRED_PERMISSIONS)

    return {
        "results": results,
        "message": "".join(info_message),
        "info_codes": info_codes,
    }
",
        "Attachment": "attachment.zip"
      },
      "outputs": [
        {
          "Name": "Permission_check_results",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.results",
          "Type": "String"
        },
        {
          "Name": "message",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.message",
          "Type": "String"
        },
        {
          "Name": "info_codes",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.info_codes",
          "Type": "StringList"
        }
      ],
      "nextStep": "ProceedOnlyIfUserHasPermission"
    },
    {
      "name": "ProceedOnlyIfUserHasPermission",
      "action": "aws:branch",
      "onFailure": "Abort",
      "description": "Branches based on whether you have permissions to all required actions for the runbook.",
      "inputs": {
        "Choices": [
          {
            "Not": {
              "Variable": "{{ 00_PreflightPermissionChecks.Permission_check_results }}",
              "StringEquals": "FAILED"
            },
            "NextStep": "01_NetworkToolDeployment"
          }
        ],
        "Default": "04_Execution_Results"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "01_NetworkToolDeployment",
      "action": "aws:executeScript",
      "description": "Creates a Lambda function in your VPC if the analysis determines network connectivity needs to be tested.",
      "onFailure": "step:03_Deletion_Lifecycle",
      "onCancel": "step:03_Deletion_Lifecycle",
      "timeoutSeconds": 400,
      "inputs": {
        "Runtime": "python3.8",
        "Handler": "lambda_deployment_handler",
        "Script": "# Copyright 2022 Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved.
# SPDX-License-Identifier: LicenseRef-.amazon.com.-AmznSL-1.0
# Licensed under the Amazon Software License  http://aws.amazon.com/asl/


############################################################################
# USAGE: lambda_deployment_handler() deploys a network tool lambda function
# in customer account with same network settings as failed task
############################################################################


############################################################################
# AWS API USAGE IN FILE: NONE
############################################################################

import boto3
import lib.aws_lambda.lambda_creator as lambda_creator
import lib.ecs.network_finder as ecs_utils
import logging
from botocore.exceptions import ClientError
from lib.aws_lambda.lambda_const import INFO_MESSAGE, ARTIFACT_NAME, FUNCTION_PREFIX, ROLE_PREFIX
from lib.ecs.skip_check import skip_check

log = logging.getLogger(__name__)


ecs_client = boto3.client("ecs")
cw_logs_client = boto3.client("logs")


def deploy_lambda(task_id, cluster_name, execution_id):
    """
    deploy_lambda() deploys a network tool lambda function
    in customer account with same network settings as failed task
    """

    deployment_result = "FAILED"
    function_arn = ""
    info_codes = []
    info_message = []
    lambda_exec_role_name = ROLE_PREFIX + execution_id
    function_name = FUNCTION_PREFIX + execution_id

    network_settings, info_codes, info_message = ecs_utils.networkconfig_finder(task_id, cluster_name)

    if not bool(info_codes):
        function_arn, info_codes, info_message = lambda_creator.create_lambda(network_settings, ARTIFACT_NAME, function_name, lambda_exec_role_name)
        if function_arn:
            deployment_result = "SUCCESS"
            info_codes.append("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I010")
            info_message.append(INFO_MESSAGE.get("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I010").format(lambda_exec_role_name))
            info_codes.append("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I009")
            info_message.append(INFO_MESSAGE.get("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I009").format(function_arn))

    return function_arn, info_codes, info_message, deployment_result


def execution_protection(describe_task_response):
    proceed_to_execute = False

    task_launch_type = describe_task_response.get("tasks")[0].get("launchType", "")
    task_stop_code = describe_task_response.get("tasks")[0].get("stopCode", "")
    task_stop_reason = describe_task_response.get("tasks")[0].get("stoppedReason", "")

    if (task_launch_type == "FARGATE" or task_launch_type == "EC2") and (task_stop_code == "TaskFailedToStart") and (not (task_stop_reason == "")):
        proceed_to_execute = True
        return proceed_to_execute
    else:
        proceed_to_execute = False
        return proceed_to_execute


def lambda_deployment_handler(events, context):
    """
    lambda_deployment_handler() deploys a network tool lambda function
    in customer account with same network settings as failed task if the
    incoming failure reason requires network point of presence for evaluation
    """

    task_id = events["TaskId"]
    cluster_name = events["ClusterName"]
    execution_id = context["automation:EXECUTION_ID"].split("-")[-1]
    function_arn = ""
    info_codes = []
    info_message = []
    task_stop_reason = ""
    proceed_to_execute = False

    # deployment_result can be "FAILED" OR "SKIPPED" OR "SUCCESS"
    # "FAILED" - Issue occured when network tool lambda function is mandatory to get deployed
    # "SKIPPED" - As per incoming task failure reason, network tool lambda function deployment can be skipped
    # "SUCCESS" - network tool lambda function required and deployed successfully

    deployment_result = "FAILED"

    try:
        describe_task_response = ecs_client.describe_tasks(cluster=cluster_name, tasks=[task_id], include=["TAGS"])
        if bool(describe_task_response.get("failures")):
            info_codes.append("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I014")
            info_message.append(INFO_MESSAGE.get("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I014").format(task_id))
            deployment_result = "FAILED"
            return {
                "deployment_result": deployment_result,
                "network_tool_lambda_arn": function_arn,
                "info_codes": info_codes,
                "message": "".join(info_message),
            }
        else:
            task_stop_reason = describe_task_response.get("tasks")[0].get("stoppedReason", "")
            proceed_to_execute = execution_protection(describe_task_response)

    except ClientError as e:
        info_message.append(f"AWS API Error at describe_tasks: {e!r}")
        deployment_result = "FAILED"
        return {
            "deployment_result": deployment_result,
            "network_tool_lambda_arn": function_arn,
            "info_codes": info_codes,
            "message": "".join(info_message),
        }

    if (skip_check(task_stop_reason)) and (proceed_to_execute):
        return {
            "deployment_result": "SKIPPED",
            "network_tool_lambda_arn": function_arn,
            "info_codes": info_codes,
            "message": "".join(info_message),
        }

    elif proceed_to_execute:
        function_arn, info_codes, info_message, deployment_result = deploy_lambda(task_id, cluster_name, execution_id)
        return {
            "deployment_result": deployment_result,
            "network_tool_lambda_arn": function_arn,
            "info_codes": info_codes,
            "message": "".join(info_message),
        }

    else:
        info_codes.append("info_codes")
        info_message.append(INFO_MESSAGE.get("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I011"))
        deployment_result = "FAILED"
        return {
            "deployment_result": deployment_result,
            "network_tool_lambda_arn": function_arn,
            "info_codes": info_codes,
            "message": "".join(info_message),
        }
",
        "InputPayload": {
          "ClusterName": "{{ ClusterName }}",
          "TaskId": "{{ TaskId }}"
        },
        "Attachment": "attachment.zip"
      },
      "outputs": [
        {
          "Name": "deployment_result",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.deployment_result",
          "Type": "String"
        },
        {
          "Name": "network_tool_lambda_arn",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.network_tool_lambda_arn",
          "Type": "String"
        },
        {
          "Name": "info_codes",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.info_codes",
          "Type": "StringList"
        },
        {
          "Name": "message",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.message",
          "Type": "String"
        }
      ],
      "nextStep": "NetworkToolDeploymentStatus"
    },
    {
      "name": "NetworkToolDeploymentStatus",
      "action": "aws:branch",
      "onFailure": "step:03_Deletion_Lifecycle",
      "onCancel": "step:03_Deletion_Lifecycle",
      "description": "Branches based on the results of the previous step.",
      "inputs": {
        "Choices": [
          {
            "Or": [
              {
                "Variable": "{{ 01_NetworkToolDeployment.deployment_result }}",
                "StringEquals": "SUCCESS"
              },
              {
                "Variable": "{{ 01_NetworkToolDeployment.deployment_result }}",
                "StringEquals": "SKIPPED"
              }
            ],
            "NextStep": "02_CoreFailureReasonEvaluation"
          }
        ],
        "Default": "03_Deletion_Lifecycle"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "02_CoreFailureReasonEvaluation",
      "action": "aws:executeScript",
      "description": "Analyzes possible causes for the failure to start your task.",
      "onFailure": "step:03_Deletion_Lifecycle",
      "onCancel": "step:03_Deletion_Lifecycle",
      "timeoutSeconds": 600,
      "inputs": {
        "Runtime": "python3.8",
        "Handler": "core_evaluation_handler",
        "Script": "# Copyright 2022 Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved.
# SPDX-License-Identifier: LicenseRef-.amazon.com.-AmznSL-1.0
# Licensed under the Amazon Software License  http://aws.amazon.com/asl/

############################################################################
# USAGE: core_evaluation_handler is the function hanlder called by the SSM
# Runbook step called 02_CoreFailureReasonEvaluation. The handler
# is responsible for for invoking checks based on task failure reason message
############################################################################


############################################################################
# AWS API USAGE IN FILE: NONE
############################################################################

import re
import logging
from lib.ecs.task import Task
from lib.vpc.remote_client import NetworkClient
from lib.ecs.registry_analysis import RegistryAnalysis
from lib.ecs.log_config_analysis import LogAnalysis
from lib.ecs.secrets_analysis import SecretAnalysis
from lib.ecs.efs_analysis import EFSAnalysis
from lib.ecs.generic_check import GenericChecks

log = logging.getLogger(__name__)


def is_pattern_in_reason_string(pattern, string) -> bool:
    """Check the service pattern in task group_name"""
    if re.search(r"\b" + re.escape(pattern) + r"\b", string):
        return True
    return False


def core_evaluation_handler(events, context):
    cluster_name = events["ClusterName"]
    task_id = events["TaskId"]
    function_arn = events["NetworkTool"]
    task_analysis_message = ""
    task_analysis_info_codes = []
    task_analysis_execution_logs: list[str] = []

    task = Task(task_id=task_id, cluster_name=cluster_name)

    # If any errors in Task state object initialization, then
    # do not proceed for evaluation
    if not bool(task._execution_error_logs):
        # Perform generic checks
        generic_checks = GenericChecks(task=task)
        generic_check_message, generic_info_codes, generic_execution_logs = generic_checks.public_ip_check()
        task_analysis_message += generic_check_message
        task_analysis_info_codes += generic_info_codes
        task_analysis_execution_logs += generic_execution_logs

        # Identifier = (ResourceInitializationError:)
        if is_pattern_in_reason_string("ResourceInitializationError", task._task_stop_reason):
            if is_pattern_in_reason_string("unable to pull secrets or registry auth", task._task_stop_reason):

                network_client = NetworkClient(function_arn=function_arn)

                # Perform registry checks
                registry_checks = RegistryAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                registry_checks_analysis, registry_checks_info_codes, registry_execution_logs = registry_checks.registry_checks()
                task_analysis_message += registry_checks_analysis
                task_analysis_info_codes += registry_checks_info_codes
                task_analysis_execution_logs += registry_execution_logs

                # Perform log configuration checks
                if bool(task.task_log_configurations):
                    log_analysis = LogAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                    log_analysis_message, log_analysis_info_codes, cw_execution_logs = log_analysis.log_configuration_analysis()
                    task_analysis_message += log_analysis_message
                    task_analysis_info_codes += log_analysis_info_codes
                    task_analysis_execution_logs += cw_execution_logs

                # Peform secrets
                if bool(task.task_secrets_references):
                    secret_analysis = SecretAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                    secret_analysis_message, secret_analysis_info_codes, secrets_execution_logs = secret_analysis._secrets_env_references()
                    task_analysis_message += secret_analysis_message
                    task_analysis_info_codes += secret_analysis_info_codes
                    task_analysis_execution_logs += secrets_execution_logs

                # Perform env files
                if bool(task.task_environment_files):
                    secret_analysis = SecretAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                    env_file_analysis_message, env_file_analysis_info_codes = secret_analysis._env_files_analysis()
                    task_analysis_message += env_file_analysis_message
                    task_analysis_info_codes += env_file_analysis_info_codes

            elif is_pattern_in_reason_string("failed to invoke EFS utils commands to set up EFS volumes", task._task_stop_reason):
                # All EFS related checks
                network_client = NetworkClient(function_arn=function_arn)
                efs_analysis = EFSAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                efs_analysis_message, efs_info_codes, efs_execution_logs = efs_analysis.efs_configuration_analysis()
                task_analysis_info_codes += efs_info_codes
                task_analysis_message += efs_analysis_message
                task_analysis_execution_logs += efs_execution_logs

            elif is_pattern_in_reason_string("failed to download env files", task._task_stop_reason):
                # All env related checks
                network_client = NetworkClient(function_arn=function_arn)
                secret_analysis = SecretAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                env_file_analysis_message, env_file_analysis_info_codes, env_execution_logs = secret_analysis._env_files_analysis()
                task_analysis_message += env_file_analysis_message
                task_analysis_info_codes += env_file_analysis_info_codes
                task_analysis_execution_logs += env_execution_logs

            elif is_pattern_in_reason_string("failed to validate logger args", task._task_stop_reason):
                network_client = NetworkClient(function_arn=function_arn)
                log_analysis = LogAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                log_analysis_message, log_analysis_info_codes, cw_execution_logs = log_analysis.log_configuration_analysis()
                task_analysis_message += log_analysis_message
                task_analysis_info_codes += log_analysis_info_codes
                task_analysis_execution_logs += cw_execution_logs

        # Identifier = (CannotPullContainerError:)
        elif is_pattern_in_reason_string("CannotPullContainerError", task._task_stop_reason):
            network_client = NetworkClient(function_arn=function_arn)

            # Perform registry checks
            registry_checks = RegistryAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
            registry_checks_analysis, registry_checks_info_codes, registry_execution_logs = registry_checks.registry_checks()
            task_analysis_message += registry_checks_analysis
            task_analysis_info_codes += registry_checks_info_codes
            task_analysis_execution_logs += registry_execution_logs

            # Peform secrets and env analysis
            if bool(task.task_secrets_references):
                secret_analysis = SecretAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                secret_analysis_message, secret_analysis_info_codes, secrets_execution_logs = secret_analysis._secrets_env_references()
                task_analysis_message += secret_analysis_message
                task_analysis_info_codes += secret_analysis_info_codes
                task_analysis_execution_logs += secrets_execution_logs

            # Peform secrets and env analysis
            if bool(task.task_environment_files):
                secret_analysis = SecretAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                env_file_analysis_message, env_file_analysis_info_codes = secret_analysis._env_files_analysis()
                task_analysis_message += env_file_analysis_message
                task_analysis_info_codes += env_file_analysis_info_codes

        # No Identifier, then perform all checks
        elif not task._task_stop_reason == "":
            network_client = NetworkClient(function_arn=function_arn)

            # Perform registry checks
            registry_checks = RegistryAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
            registry_checks_analysis, registry_checks_info_codes, registry_execution_logs = registry_checks.registry_checks()
            task_analysis_message += registry_checks_analysis
            task_analysis_info_codes += registry_checks_info_codes
            task_analysis_execution_logs += registry_execution_logs

            # Peform secrets and env analysis
            if bool(task.task_secrets_references):
                secret_analysis = SecretAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                secret_analysis_message, secret_analysis_info_codes, secrets_execution_logs = secret_analysis._secrets_env_references()
                task_analysis_message += secret_analysis_message
                task_analysis_info_codes += secret_analysis_info_codes
                task_analysis_execution_logs += secrets_execution_logs

            # Peform secrets and env analysis
            if bool(task.task_environment_files):
                secret_analysis = SecretAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                env_file_analysis_message, env_file_analysis_info_codes = secret_analysis._env_files_analysis()
                task_analysis_message += env_file_analysis_message
                task_analysis_info_codes += env_file_analysis_info_codes

            # Perform log analysis
            if bool(task.task_log_configurations):
                log_analysis = LogAnalysis(network_client=network_client, task=task)
                log_analysis_message, log_analysis_info_codes, cw_execution_logs = log_analysis.log_configuration_analysis()
                task_analysis_message += log_analysis_message
                task_analysis_info_codes += log_analysis_info_codes
                task_analysis_execution_logs += cw_execution_logs

    else:
        task_analysis_message = "Task Analysis Skipped, Please review each section of the RunBook Execution logs below"
        task_analysis_execution_logs = task._execution_error_logs

    return {
        "analysis_message": task_analysis_message,
        "task_analysis_info_codes": task_analysis_info_codes,
        "task_analysis_execution_logs": "\n".join(task_analysis_execution_logs),
    }
",
        "InputPayload": {
          "ClusterName": "{{ ClusterName }}",
          "TaskId": "{{ TaskId }}",
          "NetworkTool": "{{01_NetworkToolDeployment.network_tool_lambda_arn}}"
        },
        "Attachment": "attachment.zip"
      },
      "outputs": [
        {
          "Name": "analysis_message",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.analysis_message",
          "Type": "String"
        },
        {
          "Name": "task_analysis_info_codes",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.task_analysis_info_codes",
          "Type": "StringList"
        },
        {
          "Name": "task_analysis_execution_logs",
          "Selector": "$.Payload.task_analysis_execution_logs",
          "Type": "String"
        }
      ],
      "nextStep": "03_Deletion_Lifecycle"
    },
    {
      "name": "03_Deletion_Lifecycle",
      "action": "aws:executeScript",
      "description": "Deletes resources created by this automation.",
      "onFailure": "step:04_Execution_Results",
      "onCancel": "step:04_Execution_Results",
      "timeoutSeconds": 200,
      "inputs": {
        "Runtime": "python3.8",
        "Handler": "deletion_handler",
        "Script": "# Copyright 2022 Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved.
# SPDX-License-Identifier: LicenseRef-.amazon.com.-AmznSL-1.0
# Licensed under the Amazon Software License  http://aws.amazon.com/asl/

############################################################################
# USAGE: deletion_handler will help to delete the resources that are
# created as part of execution in previous steps. It uses same unique
# resource naming convention used in previous steps to identify and delete
# the resource that has been created
############################################################################

############################################################################
# AWS API USAGE IN FILE: NONE
############################################################################

import logging
import boto3
from botocore.exceptions import ClientError
import deletion_lifecycle.resource_deletion as resource_deletion
from lib.aws_lambda.lambda_const import FUNCTION_PREFIX
from lib.aws_lambda.lambda_const import ROLE_PREFIX
from lib.aws_lambda.lambda_const import INFO_MESSAGE

log = logging.getLogger(__name__)
cw_logs_client = boto3.client("logs")


def cw_retention_policy_change(group_name, retention_days):
    retention_modified_status = False
    info_message = ""
    try:
        cw_logs_client.put_retention_policy(logGroupName=group_name, retentionInDays=retention_days)
        retention_modified_status = True

    except cw_logs_client.exceptions.ResourceNotFoundException:
        retention_modified_status = False
        info_message += INFO_MESSAGE.get("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I015").format(group_name)

    except ClientError as e:
        retention_modified_status = False
        info_message += f"AWS API Error at cw_retention_policy_change: {e!r}\n"
        info_message += INFO_MESSAGE.get("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I013").format(group_name)

    return retention_modified_status, info_message


def deletion_handler(events, context):
    """
    deletion_handler() will help to delete the resources that are
    created as part of execution in previous steps. It uses same unique
    resource naming convention used in previous steps to identify and delete
    the resource that has been created
    """
    info_message = []
    info_codes = []
    execution_id = context["automation:EXECUTION_ID"].split("-")[-1]
    cw_retention_period = events["CloudwatchRetentionPeriod"]
    role_name = ROLE_PREFIX + execution_id
    function_name = FUNCTION_PREFIX + execution_id

    eni_deletion_flag = "FALSE"

    # Find and store Hyperplane ENI information, if it got created as part of VPC Lambda Deployment
    fetched_eni_list, eni_info_codes, eni_info_message = resource_deletion.find_hyperplane_eni(function_name)
    info_codes = info_codes + eni_info_codes
    info_message = info_message + eni_info_message

    if bool(fetched_eni_list):
        eni_deletion_flag = "TRUE"

    # Lambda function deletion
    delete_function_info_codes, delete_function_info_message = resource_deletion.delete_lambda_function(function_name)
    info_codes = info_codes + delete_function_info_codes
    info_message = info_message + delete_function_info_message

    # VPC Lambda CW Retention Policy change (If present)
    group_name = "/aws/lambda/" + function_name
    retention_modified_status, cw_info_message = cw_retention_policy_change(group_name, cw_retention_period)
    info_message.append(cw_info_message)
    if retention_modified_status:
        info_message.append(INFO_MESSAGE.get("LAMBDA_CREATOR_I012").format(group_name, cw_retention_period))

    if not (eni_deletion_flag == "TRUE"):
        # Lambda execution role deletion here only if no ENI got created, else ENI Deletion handler
        # will take care of role deletion
        delete_role_info_codes, delete_role_info_message = resource_deletion.delete_role(role_name)
        info_codes = info_codes + delete_role_info_codes
        info_message = info_message + delete_role_info_message

    return {"message": "".join(info_message), "info_codes": info_codes, "eni_list": fetched_eni_list, "eni_deletion_flag": eni_deletion_flag}
",

          "NetworkTool": "{{01_NetworkToolDeployment.network_tool_lambda_arn}}",
          "CloudwatchRetentionPeriod": "{{ CloudwatchRetentionPeriod }}"
        },

      },

CORE_MESSAGE = {
    "I010": (" \nTask Failure Reason Analysis:" "\n#############################\n" "{0}"),
}

EXECUTION_MESSAGE = {
    "I010": (
        " \nRunBook Execution logs"
        "\n######################\n"
        "\n++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++"
        "\nSTEP:00_PreflightPermissionChecks"
        "\n++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++\n"
        "{0}"
        "\n++++++++++++++++++++++++++"
        "\nSTEP:01_NetworkToolDeployment"
        "\n++++++++++++++++++++++++++\n"
        "{1}"
        "\n+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++"
        "\nSTEP:02_CoreFailureReasonEvaluation"
        "\n+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++\n"
        "{2}"
        "\n+++++++++++++++++++++++"
        "\nSTEP:03_Deletion_Lifecycle"
        "\n+++++++++++++++++++++++\n"
        "{3}"
        "\n\n"
    ),
}

ENI_DELETION_MESSAGE_FORMATTER = {
    "I020": (" \nVPC Lambda ENI Deletion Status:" "\n#############################\n" "{0}\n\n"),
}


def output_handler(events, context):
    """ """
    core_message = []
    execution_message = []
    info_codes = []
    permission_checks = events["PreflightPermissionChecks"]
    task_analysis = events["CoreFailureReasonEvaluation"]
    network_tool_deployment_status = events["NetworkToolDeployment"]
    task_analysis_execution_logs = events["task_analysis_execution_logs"]
    deletion_life_cycle = events["Deletion_Lifecycle"]

    if "02_CoreFailureReasonEvaluation.analysis" in task_analysis:
        task_analysis = "Task Analysis Skipped, Please review each section of the RunBook Execution logs"

    info_codes.append("I010")
    core_message.append(CORE_MESSAGE.get("I010").format(task_analysis))
    execution_message.append(EXECUTION_MESSAGE.get("I010").format(permission_checks, network_tool_deployment_status, task_analysis_execution_logs, deletion_life_cycle))

    return {"failure_reason": "".join(core_message), "info_codes": info_codes, "ExecutionLogs": "".join(execution_message)}


def eni_deletion_output_handler(events, context):
    eni_deletion_message = []
    info_codes = []
    eni_deletion_buffer = events["ENIDeletionMessage"]
    network_tool_status = events["NetworkToolStatus"]

    if not network_tool_status == "SUCCESS":
        eni_deletion_buffer = "ENI Deletion Skipped as VPC Lambda function not deployed"

    info_codes.append("I020")
    eni_deletion_message.append(ENI_DELETION_MESSAGE_FORMATTER.get("I020").format(eni_deletion_buffer))

    return {"deletion_status": "".join(eni_deletion_message), "info_codes": info_codes}

      "inputs": {

          {
            "And": [
              {
                "Variable": "{{ 01_NetworkToolDeployment.deployment_result }}",
                "StringEquals": "SUCCESS"
              },
              {
                "Variable": "{{ 03_Deletion_Lifecycle.eni_deletion_flag }}",
                "StringEquals": "TRUE"
              }
            ],
            "NextStep": "Sleep_For_HyperPlaneENI"
          }
        ],
        "Default": "06_ENI_Deletion_Message"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "Sleep_For_HyperPlaneENI",
      "action": "aws:sleep",
      "description": "Sleeps for 30 minutes so the elastic network interface for the Lambda function can be deleted.",
      "inputs": {
        "Duration": "PT30M"
      },
      "nextStep": "05_Lambda_ENI_Deletion_Handler"
    },
    {
      "name": "05_Lambda_ENI_Deletion_Handler",
      "action": "aws:executeScript",
      "description": "Deletes the Lambda function network interface.",
      "onFailure": "Abort",
      "onCancel": "Abort",
      "timeoutSeconds": 600,
      "maxAttempts": 3,
      "inputs": {
        "Runtime": "python3.8",

############################################################################
# USAGE: When given with ENI list, the code performs ENI deletion operation
# provided the ENI in available state, if not backoff retry performed till
# to max configured timeout
############################################################################


############################################################################
# AWS API USAGE IN FILE:
# ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces
# ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface
############################################################################
import boto3
import time
from eni_deletion_handler_const import ENI_DELETION
from lib.aws_lambda.lambda_const import ROLE_PREFIX
import deletion_lifecycle.resource_deletion as resource_deletion
from botocore.exceptions import ClientError


def eni_deletion_handler(event, context):
    """
    The eni_deletion_handler() will check the status of the ENI that was utilized by the AWS Lambda
    service to perform calls to resources within the VPC and attempt to delete it.
    There can be the case where no action is required by the ENI Deletion Handler as the Lambda service
    might have already deleted it.
    """
    core_message = ""
    info_codes = []
    execution_logs = []
    execution_id = context["automation:EXECUTION_ID"].split("-")[-1]
    role_name = ROLE_PREFIX + execution_id

    ec2_client = boto3.client("ec2")
    try:
        eni_list: list = event["ENI"]
    except Exception:
        eni_list: list = []

    # Try to delete the lambda execution role as it was skipped in DeletionLifecycle
    # for lambda to perform automated ENI deletion during 30 minutes of sleep time
    delete_role_info_codes, delete_role_info_message = resource_deletion.delete_role(role_name)
    info_codes = info_codes + delete_role_info_codes
    core_message = core_message + "\n".join(delete_role_info_message)

    if eni_list:
        is_eni_available = False
        eni_not_found = False
        time_counter = 0
        while not eni_not_found and time_counter < 300 and (not is_eni_available):
            time_counter += 20
            try:
                eni_status = ec2_client.describe_network_interfaces(NetworkInterfaceIds=eni_list)
                for nw_interface in eni_status.get("NetworkInterfaces"):
                    if nw_interface.get("Status") == "available":
                        is_eni_available = True
                    else:
                        time.sleep(20)
            except ClientError as e:
                if e.response["Error"].get("Code") == "InvalidNetworkInterfaceID.NotFound":
                    info_codes.append("ENI_DELETION_I004")
                    execution_logs.append(ENI_DELETION.get("ENI_DELETION_I004").format(eni_list))
                    core_message += ENI_DELETION.get("ENI_DELETION_I004").format(eni_list)
                    eni_not_found = True

        if is_eni_available:
            result_deletion_result, error_code = delete_lambda_eni(ec2_client, nw_interface.get("NetworkInterfaceId"))
            if result_deletion_result:
                info_codes.append("ENI_DELETION_I004")
                execution_logs.append(ENI_DELETION.get("ENI_DELETION_I004"))
                core_message += ENI_DELETION.get("ENI_DELETION_I004")
            elif error_code == "IN_USE":
                info_codes.append("ENI_DELETION_I003")
                core_message += ENI_DELETION.get("ENI_DELETION_I003").format(eni_list)
                execution_logs.append(ENI_DELETION.get("ENI_DELETION_I003")).format(eni_list)
    else:
        info_codes.append("ENI_DELETION_I001")
        execution_logs.append("ENI Deletion Handler execution has finished succesfully.")
        core_message += ENI_DELETION.get("ENI_DELETION_I001").format(eni_list)

    return {"message": core_message, "info_codes": info_codes, "execution_logs": execution_logs}


def delete_lambda_eni(client, eni_id):
    execution_result = False
    error_code = ""
    try:
        client.delete_network_interface(NetworkInterfaceId=eni_id)
        execution_result = True
    except ClientError as e:
        if e.response["Error"].get("Code") == "InvalidNetworkInterfaceID.NotFound":
            execution_result = True
        elif e.response["Error"].get("Code") == "InvalidNetworkInterface.InUse":
            error_code = "IN_USE"
        else:
            error_code = e.response["Error"].get("Code")
    return execution_result, error_code

          "NetworkTool": "{{01_NetworkToolDeployment.network_tool_lambda_arn}}",
          "ENI": "{{ 03_Deletion_Lifecycle.eni_list }}"
